assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets contain no reporting about a DHS appropriations lapse or any partial shutdown event; no confirmation or disconfirmation is available.
No item references FERC issuing a NOPR or formal policy proposal on cost allocation/interconnection requirements for large-load data centers; status remains unresolved.

The CNBC item about Altman heading to India for an AI summit does not report a consumer distribution partnership (telecom/OEM) bundling a paid ChatGPT tier; no explicit bundle announcement is evidenced.
No news bullet mentions an India-based AI compute/data-center platform startup raising >=$750M in a single round; no clear evidence either way.
No bullet references JNTO monthly statistics or a >=15% YoY decline in mainland China visitor arrivals; cannot be assessed from today’s news set.
The provided items do not include data on aggregate U.S. spot Bitcoin ETF net flows over a 30-day window; no confirmation of >=$2.5B outflows.
While there is general media-industry coverage (e.g., Anderson Cooper leaving '60 Minutes'), nothing indicates Warner Bros. Discovery and Paramount have confirmed exclusive talks or a term sheet/MOU.
No bullet indicates the European Commission published an implementing/delegated act or guidance specifying reporting/recordkeeping requirements for the unsold apparel/footwear destruction ban.
No news item reports any U.S. auto industry group or automaker filing a lawsuit about EPA ending stop-start regulatory crediting; no clear evidence to update.
No bullet mentions Canada awarding a >=C$1.0B defense contract to a non-U.S.-headquartered prime contractor framed as diversification/industrial policy; unresolved.
